ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 36
ygData.msgSnippet: I would think that this would be quite an adjustment as it would affect the smiths as well.  Considering they already lose money, that would  be WAY to
ygData.messageBody:
I would think that this would be quite an adjustment as it would affect the
smiths as well. Considering they already lose money, that would be WAY to
detrimental. I think they will either raise the price of the sketches or
the raw materials.

dwh
----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Miser <jmiser@...>
To: <EQ_Potters@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, July 25, 1999 10:38 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Potters] Digest Number 36


> From: Jason Miser <jmiser@...>
>
> Yes you are right about speculation, and who is to say that the cost of
> the sketches are going to go up? what if the pie tin price goes down
> instead?
>
> On Mon, 26 Jul 1999, Love, Paul wrote:
>
> > From: "Love, Paul " <love@...>
> >
> > Well we knew it would be coming I haven't checked yet but if it is only
on
> > the test server this is my recommendation. Pot till you drop because it
> > will be everywhere on Tuesday. The second thing is the mystical word
> > SPECULATION. You heard it right just like the big time investors do on
TV.
> > When you get ready to log off for the last time before the patch fill
your
> > inventory with those beautiful sketches that cost a little over a
silver.
> > Since you can usually sell items back for about half of the store price
and
> > the store price is now over a plat you should be able to sell each
sketch
> > for about a 5G profit. Assume that you fill the bank and your personal
> > inventory with sketches. 8 bank slots 8 personal slots each with a
> > backpack. That is 128 available slots to fill with stacks of 20
sketches
> > for a total of 2560 sketches each with a 5G profit. Surprise, Surprise
that
> > is over 1000P in one night with no effort on your part : ) Enjoy it.
It
> > may be the last profit you will see with pottery.
> >
> >
> > >Message: 4
> > > Date: Sat, 24 Jul 1999 14:38:07 -0500
> > > From: Ascii <in@...>
> > >Subject: Re: Well tiime to get POed pottery buffs....
> > >
> > > What are you talking about? 1225c per sketch? Last night I made my
> > usual
> > >batch of pie tins and made the same 5 plat profit I usually make. Or
are
> > you
> > >talking about the upcoming changes on the test server?
> >
> >
>
